title: Nick Kroll Announces Human Resources, A Big Mouth Spinoff
text:
Photo: Taylor Hill/WireImage

Netflix is all in on Big Mouth, which the streamer renewed for three more seasons over the summer, and it wants even more animated content from co-creator Nick Kroll. Today at New York Comic Con, Kroll announced a Big Mouth spinoff called Human Resources that will focus on the world of monsters teased in the last season of Mouth. “We are incredibly excited to tell a lot of different kinds of stories, not just about puberty, but all the stories of life,” Kroll told the crowd. He didn’t share any details about the show, beyond that it will basically be a workplace comedy, but the actor did say a new female hormone monster will join Big Mouth next season. So, maybe we’ll be seeing her around the office in Human Resources, too. BoJack Horseman may be on its way out at Netflix, but at least it’s picking up adult Monsters, Inc.
description: Nick Kroll announced at New York Comic Con that a Big Mouth spinoff called Human Resources is on the way, and it will focus on the world of the monsters.
